org.xchain.framework.servlet

Class CatalogServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • org.xchain.framework.servlet.CatalogServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    public class CatalogServlet
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    This servlet can be used to bind servlet requests to xchains inside of an application. To do this, this servlet tasks the following action:
    1. The requested url is translated into the name of a catalog. This catalog is then loaded.
    2. The requested method is translated into a qname. This command is loaded from the catalog.
    3. The servlet request and response are used to create a JXPathContext.
    4. The JXPathcContext is used to execute the command.
    Author:
    Mike Moulton, Devon Tackett, Christian Trimble, John Trimble, Josh Kennedy
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • executeCommand

        public void executeCommand(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                    throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                           java.io.IOException
        Execute the proper XChain based on the incoming HttpServletRequest and sending output on the HttpServletResponse. The path on the request determines which catalog to use while the method of the request determines which command to execute.
        Parameters:
        request - The incoming request.
        response - The outgoing response.
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        java.io.IOException

      • catalogNameForRequest

        protected java.lang.String catalogNameForRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Get the catalog based on the requested path.
        Parameters:
        request - The incoming HttpServletRequest.
        Returns:
        The full requested catalog name.

      • commandNameForRequest

        protected javax.xml.namespace.QName commandNameForRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Get the command requested based on the request method.
        Parameters:
        request - The incoming HttpServletRequest.
        Returns:
        The QName of the requested command.

      • jXPathContext

        protected org.apache.commons.jxpath.JXPathContext jXPathContext(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,

        Build a new JXPathContext and populate it with the given request and response.
        Parameters:
        request - The incoming HttpServletRequest.
        response - The outgoing HttpServletResponse.
        Returns:
        A JXPath which contains the servlet request and response.
